creator: gavin.stevenson@kcom.com
text:
tomcat 4.03 - using coyote http connector
jdk 1.4

i have had this error three times now, always with the same servlet, which is a 
fairly heavily used small servlet.
The exception is as follows, it doesnt appear to be related to my code, as none 
of my classes are in the stack trace. And this has only started happening with 
tomcat 4.03.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapper.allocate
(StandardWrapper.java:673)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke
(StandardWrapperValve.java:214)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:566)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke
(StandardPipeline.java:472)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:943)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke
(StandardContextValve.java:190)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:566)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.CertificatesValve.invoke
(CertificatesValve.java:246)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:564)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke
(StandardPipeline.java:472)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:943)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.invoke
(StandardContext.java:2343)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke
(StandardHostValve.java:180)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:566)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorDispatcherValve.invoke
(ErrorDispatcherValve.java:170)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:564)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke
(ErrorReportValve.java:170)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:564)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve.invoke
(AccessLogValve.java:468)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:564)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke
(StandardPipeline.java:472)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:943)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke
(StandardEngineValve.java:174)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invokeNext
(StandardPipeline.java:566)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke
(StandardPipeline.java:472)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:943)

(CoyoteProcessor.java:870)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
First, this should only happen with a single thread servlet model servlet. You 
should have mentioned it in your report.
Then, I will require a test case to investigate this (otherwise, it's a 
WORKFORME, as my test STM servlets work fine).

creator: gavin.stevenson@kcom.com
text:
looking at it i probably don't need STM anymore so if removing that will fix 
the problem i will do that, ive attached the offending servlet(cut down 
version), if you need/want more let me know

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Thanks, I'll look at it.
Yes, removing STM should make the error go away.
Also, does using Coyote make a difference here ? (I assume not)
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
the null pointer exception did occour once before i upgraded to the coyote 
connector
creator: gavin.stevenson@kcom.com

text:
After some testing, I am unable to reproduce this.
Could you give more details about how to reproduce it ? Does it happen under load ?
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
This servlet is frequently used, but the load at any particula time is fairly 
low. Also there can be large periods of time when the servlet is not used such 
as over the weekend. Also it was it appeard to happen after the server had been 
running for about 4 days.
Ill try and replicate the error here and let you know what i find, however ive 
currently got a large work load, so it may be a week or so.
creator: gavin.stevenson@kcom.com

text:
I haven't been able to reproduce this. If you are still experiencing the
problem, you could try to work in the code to try to figure out what happens
(the class is org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapper).
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
I have fixed a similar error which occurred after a reload of the webapp.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 17292 ***
creator: remm@apache.org
